intro: Rhododendron obtusum var. mikawanum, commonly known as the Mikawanum azalea, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It features dense, dark green foliage and produces clusters of fragrant, pink to red flowers in the spring. The plant has elliptical leaves that are typically 2–5 cm long and are arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full shade. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its historical significance in Japanese horticulture.
